sameAnalysis.part_name: 这些动词都含"懂，知道，明了"之意。
means: know ： 普通用词，多指通过学习、经验或他人传播而得到知识，含直接知道的意味。
learn ： 通常指通过他人而获得消息或情况，侧重从不知到知的变化过程。
comprehend ： 侧重熟悉了解的过程。
understand ： 指对事物已有彻底的认识，不仅知其性质、含义和细节，而且了解其内外的关系。

sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个动词均含"学习"之意。
means: learn ： 常指一般性的学习，尤指初级阶段的学习，表示摹仿实践的过程；着重成果时，作"学会"解。
study ： 着重指学习过程和高深的或周密的研究，尤指从书本上学习。

entry.def: If you learn something, you obtain knowledge or a skill through studying or training.

example.ex: Their children were going to learn English...
He is learning to play the piano.

entry.def: If you learn of something, you find out about it.

example.ex: It was only after his death that she learned of his affair with Betty...
example.tran: 一直到他死后她才知道他和贝蒂有染。

example.ex: It didn't  come as a shock to learn that the fuel and cooling systems are the most common causes of breakdown...
example.tran: 燃油和冷却系统是造成故障的最常见的原因，这一点不奇怪。

entry.def: If people learn to behave or react in a particular way, they gradually start to behave in that way as a result of a change in attitudes.
entry.tran: 学会（以某种方式行事或反应）

example.ex: You have to learn to face your problem...
example.tran: 你要学会面对自己的问题。

example.ex: We are learning how to confront death instead of avoiding its reality.
example.tran: 我们在学习如何直面死亡，而非回避死亡这一现实。

entry.def: If you learn from an unpleasant experience, you change the way you behave so that it does not happen again or so that, if it happens again, you can deal with it better.

example.ex: I am convinced that he has learned from his mistakes...
example.tran: 我深信他已从错误中吸取了教训。

example.ex: The company failed to learn any lessons from this experience.
example.tran: 公司未能从这次经历中吸取任何教训。

entry.def: If you learn something such as a poem or a role in a play, you study or repeat the words so that you can remember them.

example.ex: He learned this song as an inmate at a Texas prison.
example.tran: 他在得克萨斯监狱服刑时学会了这首歌。

means.word_mean: 1. acquire or gain knowledge or skills;

sentences.sentence: "Children acquire language at an amazing rate"

means.word_mean: 2. get to know or become aware of, usually accidentally;

sentences.sentence: "I learned that she has two grown-up children"
"I see that you have been promoted"

means.word_mean: 3. commit to memory; learn by heart;

sentences.sentence: "Have you memorized your lines for the play yet?"

means.word_mean: 4. be a student of a certain subject;

sentences.sentence: "She is reading for the bar exam"
"He instructed me in building a boat"

means.word_mean: 6. find out, learn, or determine with certainty, usually by making an inquiry or other effort;

sentences.sentence: "I want to see whether she speaks French"
"Check whether the train leaves on time"
